author: soyacincau
title: OnePlus One now on open sale with no invitation required
tags: Android,OnePlus,OnePlus Malaysia,OnePlus One,OnePlus One Open Sale,smart phone
contents: It’s almost a year since the  OnePlus One  was  announced  with a bold claim of being a 2014 flagship killer. If you’re hoping for a new device, unfortunately there isn’t any  being announced today . Instead OnePlus has announced that they are doing away with the invitation system and anyone can purchase a OnePlus One all day everyday in its available countries.  However for the upcoming  OnePlus 2 , they shared that it will be released first with an invitation system. OnePlus explained that like any new product, there are risks especially when they are selling devices with very thin margins. With the invitation system in place, they can mitigate such risks and eventually they will open up its sales once the product reaches maturity.  As an added bonus, they are giving a special 24 hour discounted sale on one of their accessories picked by their resident Shiba Inu. As selected, the  OnePlus Flip Covers  and  Premium Screen Protectors  will be sold at 75% discount. The promotions are only applicable in USA/Canada, the European Union, Hong Kong, and Taiwan.  For Malaysia, the OnePlus will be  available  starting 22nd April and  Maxis  will be the exclusive telco partner. According to OnePlus, there’s no invite system and the One will also be available for purchase without contract from Maxis.  [  SOURCE  ]

author: soyacincau
title: TM offers faster 30Mbps and 50Mbps Unifi Home packages at selected areas
tags: FTTH,P1,P1 4G,TM,TM P1 Combo,TM Unifi,TM Unifi 30Mbps,TM Unifi 50Mbps,Unifi,Unifi 30Mbps,Unifi 50Mbps
contents: UPDATE : TM’s Unifi  30Mbps and 50Mbps plans  are now available.  For those with the need for speed, TM is now offering faster 30Mbps and 50Mbps Unifi options for residential use at selected locations. The plans were discovered by  Amanz  and TM is offering them as a bundled package with its HyppTV subscription.  The base option with 30Mbps connection is going for RM210.94/month inclusive of GST. This lets you add-on a TV Pack of either HyppTV Aneka , Varnam or Ruby. If you want more channels, it will cost you RM242.74/month for its HyppTV Jumbo Package.  To bump up from 30Mbps to 50Mbps, TM is offering the extra 20Mbps speed as an add-on upgrade at RM53/month on top of its base offering. So at the bare minimum, this calculates to RM263.94/month inclusive of GST. Not bad, considering the current  VIP 20Mbps plan  is also priced the same at RM263.94/month. Interestingly, TM is also offering P1 as an extra add-on. The P1 ToGo Plan with a USB modem is offered at RM30.74/month extra and it comes with 5GB quota with 1Mbps download speeds.  If you look at the price, you’ll notice that free calls within fixed lines isn’t included like its standard Unifi VIP 5Mbps, 10Mbps and 20Mbps offering. By default, all domestic voice calls to both fixed and mobile numbers are charged at RM0.21/minute. For those who plan to talk a lot, you can add RM21.20/month for a voice pack which comes with 600 minutes of phone calls. When you used up your minutes, you can still continue to make free calls to fixed lines while calls to mobile numbers are charged at a lower flat rate of RM0.11/minute.  According to the source, these new packages are only applicable at Bangsar, Damansara Utama, Kepong, Menara TM, Puchong, Serdang, Shah Alam and USJ Taipan for new subscribers only. Existing subscribers are not eligible for an upgrade and the 50Mbps service is limited to low-rise buildings only.  [  SOURCE  ]

author: soyacincau
title: ASUS introduces 10,050mAh ZenPower with Quick Charge
tags: ASUS 10000mAh ZenPower,ASUS PowerBank,ASUS ZenPower,ASUS ZenPower Indonesia,indonesia,Jakarta,Power Bank
contents: UPDATE : The ASUS ZenPower is  officially priced  at 269,000 Rupiah, which is about RM75. Remember this  familiar power bank ? ASUS has revealed an improved version during its  Zenfone 2  regional launch that’s expected to be released for our South East Asian market.  Similar to Xiaomi’s popular powerbanks, the ZenPower uses an aluminium body casing but it differentiates itself with a more boxy shape. It is also available in 5 different anodised aluminium colours such as black, gold, red, blue and silver. For added protection, there are optional rubber sleeves available too. Dimension wise, the ZenPower claims to be about the size of a credit card and it weighs 215 grams, which is slightly lighter than the 10,400mAh Mi Power Bank at 250g. Internally, ASUS uses Panasonic battery cells with 10,050mAh capacity and you can check its battery levels from its 4 LED lights by pressing its huge power button. There’s only a single micro USB and one full size USB output but the 10,050mAh ZenPower supports quick charge by pushing 2.4Amps at 5V, instead of the usual 2.0/2.1Amps output from standard chargers or power banks. To charge the PowerBank itself is a standard 2Amps input which takes 5.5 hours to charge according to its official brochure. No word on its availability and pricing yet, but it could make an appearance during our local  Incredible ZenDay event  on 9th May.

author: soyacincau
title: LG teases professional photography features on the G4
tags: Android,Colby Brown,F/1.8 Camera Lens,LG G4,LG G4 Camera,LG G4 launch,LG G4 Specs,LG G4 Teaser,Photography,smart phone
contents: The  LG G4  that’s launching end of this month is expected to shake up the camera phone segment with its  faster f/1.8 lens . To showcase its imaging capabilities, they have engaged professional photographer  Colby Brown  to use the LG G4 as his new camera.  From the teaser, he highlights the G4’s low light capability, colour accuracy and better controls with an array of manual settings. At the moment, the Galaxy S6 / S6 edge with a 16MP f/1.9 shooter is a  stellar camera phone  and it looks like LG is trying to have an edge over it with a faster f/1.8 lens coupled with a 16MP sensor with Optical Image Stabiliser. Watch the teaser after the break. [  SOURCE  ]

author: Sirap Bandung
title: ASUS Zenfone 2 launched in South East Asia. Coming to Malaysia in May
tags: Android,Asus,ASUS ZenFone 2,ASUS Zenfone 2 Indonesia,ASUS ZenFone 2 Launch,ASUS ZenFone 2 Malaysia,mobile device,smart phone,ZenFone 2,zenfone 2 launch
contents: Announced earlier this year at  CES  and ASUS has officially launched the successor to their popular Zenfone, the  ASUS Zenfone 2  for the South East Asian region. Two models were launched, the higher end ZE551ML and its slightly lower end sibling the ZE550ML which both are having a 5.5″ display. The higher end 2015 refresh of the Zenfone is equipped with a 5.5-inch Full HD IPS display and a newer quad-core 64-bit 2.3GHz Z3580 Atom processor. The ZenFone 2 (ZE551ML) is also home to a massive 4GB RAM, 32GB storage as well as a 13 megapixel f/2.0 rear and 5 megapixel front camera combo and a large 3,000 mAh battery to boot. A larger 64GB storage version is also announced as well in today’s event.  Out of the box, it will run on the latest Android 5.0 Lollipop with ZenUI 2.0 on top. The smartphone is incredibly thin at 3.9mm (at the thinnest point), making it quite literally one of the thinnest on the market. The Zenfone 2’s slightly cheaper sibling (ZE550ML) is a notch below with a 5.5″ 720p IPS display, 1.8GHz Z3560 quad-core processor and 2GB RAM under the hood. Both smartphones get an extra 5GB ASUS web storage. In terms of price, the high-spec ZenFone 2 ZE551ML with 4GB RAM is priced at 4,499,000 Rupiah (about RM1,266) for the 64GB storage version and 3,999,000 Rupiah (RM1,125) for the smaller 32GB unit. For a lower spec alternative with a Full HD display, the ZE551ML is also available with a 1.8GHz Z3560 Intel Atom processor, 2GB RAM and 16GB storage at 2,999,000 Rupiah (RM849). Meanwhile its lower spec ZE550ML with a 5.5″ HD 720p display and 16GB storage is going for 2,699,000 Rupiah (about RM757). These are the prices for the Indonesian market and we reckon the Malaysian pricing could be cheaper.  Other accessories have been announced as well including the View Flip Cover at 159,000 Rupiah (RM45), ZenEar S Headphones at 699,000 Rupiah (RM196) and ZenEar Headphones at 79,000 Rupiah (RM22). Their  ZenPower with 10,000mAh capacity  is going for 269,000 Rupiah (RM75). Also introduced is a couple of flash photography accessory such as the LolliFlash that plugs into the Zenfone 2’s audio jack at 119,000 Rupiah (RM33) and the ZenFlash at 239,000 Rupiah (RM67).  For those who cannot wait, you can pick up  the most powerful model  from grey importers at RM 1,299 (before GST). ASUS Malaysia will be launching the  Zenfone 2 officially in Malaysia  next month on 9th May.

author: soyacincau
title: Honor 4C and Honor 6 Plus are launching in Malaysia
tags: Android,CHM-U01,Dual Sim,Honor,Honor 4C,Honor 4C Malaysia,Honor 4C Malaysia Launch,Honor 6 Plus,Honor 6 Plus Malaysia,Honor 6 Plus Malaysia Launch,Honor Malaysia,huawei,Huawei Honor,smart phone
contents: In conjunction with Honor Malaysia’s  first anniversary , they will be launching 2 new smart phones for the Malaysian market. As  teased earlier , the  Honor 6 Plus  will be coming to our shores, offering a large 5.5″ display in an affordable package. For those waiting for the replacement of its cheap and cheerful  Honor 3C , its new 5″ smart phone successor, the Honor 4C will be launched in Malaysia as well.  The first anniversary bash is happening on  28th April at KLCC . Head after the break on for more details of the two incoming smart phones.  The Honor 4C looks like a baby  Honor 4X , with a compact 5″ IPS HD 720p display. According to the Honor 4C  spec in Russia , it gets a similar 1.2GHz Octa-Core Kirin 620 processor with 2GB of RAM. It also gets 8GB of on-board storage that’s also expandable with microSD. Even the cameras are similar with a main 13MP rear camera and a front facing 5MP unit. Keeping the lights on is a 2,550mAh capacity battery, which is more than the Honor 3C’s 2,300mAh unit. Like the previous Honor 3C, it also support dual-SIMs but 4G LTE doesn’t seem to be listed. In Russia, the Honor 4C is priced at 8,990 Ruble (about RM609), while its bigger Honor 4X is priced at 11,990 Ruble (about RM813). With the current Honor 4X priced at RM619 (inclusive of GST), we wonder if Honor Malaysia could price their 4C at the same RM499 price point as the former Honor 3C.    If you want something with more grunt with a larger screen, the Honor 6 Plus is essentially the bigger brother of its current  Honor 6 . It features a larger 5.5″ Full HD display and underneath it runs on a high-spec 1.8GHz Octa-Core Kirin 925 processor with 3GB RAM along with expandable 32GB of storage. At the rear it gets dual 8MP main cameras while the front also features a 8MP selfie cam. Being a phablet device, it gets juiced up with a generous 3,600mAh capacity battery. The Honor 6 Plus supports dual-SIMs in 4G LTE.  To join the launch, you can sign up for a chance to win an invite over at  VMall.my .

author: soyacincau
title: Maxis offers the OnePlus One 64GB on contract at RM859
tags: Android,Maxis,Maxis OnePlus One,MaxisONE Plan,OnePlus,OnePlus Malaysia,OnePlus Malaysia Launch,OnePlus Maxis,OnePlus One,OnePlus One Malaysia,OnePlus One Malaysia Fan Gathering,OnePlus One Malaysia Launch,OnePlus One Maxis,OnePlus One Pre-order,OnePlus smartphone,smart phone,smartphone
contents: The long awaited  OnePlus One  is going on sale in Malaysia starting tomorrow with Maxis as their  exclusive  telco partner. For Malaysia, we are getting its higher capacity 64GB model in Sandstone Black which is priced outright at RM1,199 (exclusive of GST). With MaxisOne Plan (+1GB) contract, the One can be yours at RM859 with 24 months duration. It will be available at all Maxis Stores, and this is probably the first time the OnePlus One is sold officially offline.  In terms of contract bundle, the One is tied to a MaxisOne Plan with a bolt-on 1GB option at RM158/month. However as a special promo, the bolt-on RM30/GB is waived for the first year, so you’ll just pay RM128/month for the first 12 months. As an added bonus, those who subscribe before 28th April will get an extra 1GB (for the 1st 6 months), giving you a total of 4GB per month. On top of the standard 1 year limited warranty, Maxis will be offering a 1 to 1 device swap for the first 1 month until the end of May at all Maxis Centres.  So far Maxis didn’t indicate that the OnePlus One would be available outright but earlier on OnePlus One mentions that potential buyers  would be able to do so  at their stores. UPDATE : In a new  forum post , OnePlus has updated that the OnePlus One 64GB will be available unlocked without contract at RM1,199. You can purchase it either online at  Maxis.com.my  or at  Maxis Stores nationwide . They added that OnePlus accessories will be sold at Maxis Centres and if you mention the password “Never Settle”, they will throw in an extra free screen protector with your purchase. UPDATE 2 : You can also buy the OnePlus One outright without contract on  Maxis Online Store . For more info, visit the  OnePlus One Malaysia  page.

author: soyacincau
title: Xiaomi Mi Note and Mi 4 3G version certified in SIRIM
tags: Mi 4,Mi 4 3G,Mi 4 WCDMA,Mi Note,Mi Note Singapore,SIRIM,Xiaomi,Xiaomi 2014215,Xiaomi 2015011,Xiaomi Malaysia,Xiaomi Mi 4,Xiaomi Mi 4 Malaysia,Xiaomi Mi Note,Xiaomi Mi Note Malaysia,Xiaomi Singapore
contents:
Xiaomi will be  announcing  a new  global phone  this Thursday but here in Malaysia, there are 2 new smart phones being spotted in our local SIRIM database. As promised by Xiaomi, the  Mi Note  is heading for Malaysia in Q2 and it has just passed certification with the model number 2015011. It supports dual-SIMs and most importantly it supports our local 1800MHz/2600MHz 4G LTE bands. The same device was also spotted in Singapore’s IDA database with the marketing name “Mi Note”. Meanwhile the 2nd device with the model  20140215  is none other than the  Mi 4  3G version. Which is quite surprising considering Xiaomi mentions that they have  no plans to bring the Mi 4  due to lack of full 4G LTE support especially the 2600MHz band that’s widely used in Malaysia.  To recap on the specs, the Mi Note standard version features a 5.7″ Full HD display, 2.5GHz Snapdragon 801 processor with 3GB RAM and comes with 16GB or 64GB of storage. It also gets a 13MP OIS main and a front facing 4MP camera. Keeping the lights on is a 3,000mAh capacity battery and overall it weighs 161 grams with a thickness of 6.95mm. You can check out our Mi Note first impressions and hands-on  here . For the Mi 4, it is quite similar except that it gets a 5″ Full HD display, a 13MP f/1.8 main camera and a front facing 8MP f/1.8 unit. In China, there are  several variations  of the Mi 4 available and looks like we are getting the Unicom 3G unit. Just recently, they have also announced a cheaper version which comes with 2GB RAM instead of 3GB. In this day and age, would you get a flagship without 4G LTE? Thanks  @Piratz  for the tip! Mi Note and Mi 4 Malaysia SIRIM Certification 
 Mi Note Singapore IDA Certification

author: soyacincau
title: BlackBerry Leap spotted in SIRIM database. Launch happening soon?
tags: blackberry,BlackBerry Leap,BlackBerry Leap Launch,BlackBerry Leap Malaysia,SIRIM
contents:
Just when you thought BlackBerry is keeping quiet, its new  Leap  could be making its way into Malaysia. Announced during  MWC 2015 , the Leap is an affordable new smart phone that’s a notch above its current  BlackBerry Z3 . With its appearance on our local SIRIM database, its local launch might be near. Like the BlackBerry Z3, it gets a similar 5″ display but it pushes a higher HD 720p resolution. Powering the device is a rather dated dual-core 1.5GHz Snapdragon S4 Plus processor with 2GB of RAM. There’s also 16GB of storage with microSD expansion, 8MP main and 2MP front cameras. Like the latest BlackBerry range, it runs on BlackBerry 10.3.1 which comes with productivity tools such as BlackBerry Blend and BlackBerry Assistant. For faster connectivity, it also supports 4G LTE and Wifi 802.11n as well as Bluetooth 4.0 LE. With a 2,800mAh capacity battery, the Leap is bulkier than the Z3 at 170 g and it is thicker too at 9.5mm. In Europe, it is priced at US$275 which is about RM999.  BlackBerry Leap SIRIM certification 
 Thanks  @KevinNgTK  for the tip!

author: soyacincau
title: OnePlus to announce something on Monday. What could this be?
tags: Android,OnePlus,OnePlus Event,OnePlus One,oneplus two,smart phone
contents: Out of the blue, OnePlus has teased an announcement event that’s happening next Monday, 20th of April. There are no details at this point but some are guessing could it be a step closer to its upcoming  OnePlus Two  flagship for 2015. For this year, OnePlus is planning on releasing  2 new devices  but it is still too early for them to announce a new flagship device which is targeted for Q3. Perhaps, is this their new budget friend smart phone that’s priced below its current One? As suggested by its tweet, anything could happen and it might be another quirky new product or accessory from the aspiring new brand. For Malaysia, the OnePlus One is finally  making its way into Malaysia  with Maxis as its  exclusive telco partner . On 24th April, they are organising a  Fan Gathering  at KLCC Tower, and you can find out how to take part over  here . [  SOURCE ,  VIA  ]

author: soyacincau
title: HTC Malaysia’s new flagship launch happening 28th April. Stand a chance to win exclusive invites
tags: Android,HTC,HTC Malaysia,HTC One M9,HTC One M9 Malaysia,HTC One M9 Plus,HTCOneLife,More Than One,smart phone
contents: If you’ve been waiting for the  HTC One M9 , this is it. As  teased a few days  back, HTC will be launching its latest flagship smart phone in Malaysia on 28th April. Now the full event details have been revealed and it will be held at Rootz Club KL at 6PM.  To join the launch, HTC is giving out exclusive invites and you can stand a chance of winning a spot by registering yourself  here . Each selected participant will be able to bring another pax and take note that registration will close on 24th April at 11:59PM. To recap on the specs, the HTC One M9 maintains the similar 5.0″ Full HD display as the previous One M8. As a 2015 flagship, it gets a new Octa-Core Snapdragon 810 processor with 3GB of RAM and the back camera has been upgraded with a single 20MP main shooter. You can check out our  first impressions  from their global launch over  here . With the  teaser  hinting “More than One”, we could be seeing its larger sibling, the  HTC One M9+  which was launched in Beijing recently. Compared to the One M9, the M9+ gets a slightly larger 5.2″ display that pushes a higher Quad HD resolution. Under its all metal body is a MediaTek MT6795 processor with 3GB of RAM.  To secure your spot at the launch, don’t forget to register yourself  here . [  SOURCE  ]

author: soyacincau
title: Xiaomi’s high-spec Mi Note Pro goes on sale in May
tags: Mi Note,Mi Note Pro,Xiaomi,Xiaomi Mi Note,Xiaomi Mi Note Pro,Xiaomi Mi Note Pro Availability,Xiaomi Mi Note Pro Sales
contents: The  Mi Note Pro  that boasts a higher resolution Quad HD display, Qualcomm’s top of the line Snapdragon 810 processor and 4GB of RAM is finally going on sale. A few days ago, the device was  certified  under China’s TENNA certification database. Now Xiaomi has updated on its Weibo account that pre-orders will start on 6th May and the Mi Note Pro with 64GB storage will be priced at 3,299 CNY, which is equivalent to RM1,934. As comparison, the standard Mi Note is priced at 2,299 CNY (RM1,347) for 16GB, while the 64GB version is going for 2,799 CNY (RM1,640).  To recap on the specs, the Mi Note Pro gets a 5.7″ IPS display that does 2560×1440 pixels resolution. Underneath, it runs on a 2.0GHz Snapdragon 810 Octa-Core processor that’s mated to 4GB RAM and has 64GB of storage which isn’t expandable. As included is a 13MP camera with Optical Image Stabilisation while selfie duties are handled by a 4MP front camera with a larger 2 micron pixel size sensor.  Keeping the lights on is a 3,000mAh capacity battery which gives it an overall thickness of just 6.95mm and a weight of 161grams. It supports 4G LTE up to Cat 9 speeds and there’s dual-SIM support as well.  The only difference with the Standard Mi Note is its lower Full HD 5.7″ display, Quad-Core 2.5GHz Snapdragon 801 processor and 3GB of RAM. In terms of colours, the Mi Note gets Black and White colours, while the Mi Note Pro is available only in White with a golden frame. You can see how it compares with other flagship phablets in our  comparison . For Malaysia, Xiaomi initially mentions that we would be getting the standard Mi Note in the 2nd quarter of 2015. For those who can’t wait, you can count on grey importers to offer the Mi Note Pro in Malaysia.  To get to know the Mi Note series better, you can check out our hands-on video below or read our  Mi Note first impressions  from its launch.  [  SOURCE  ]

author: soyacincau
title: Honor 6 Plus coming soon. Possibly announced end of this month
tags: DoubleBokeh,Honor 6 Plus,Honor 6 Plus Malaysia,Honor Malaysia,Honor Malaysia 1st Anniversary,Huawei Honor 6 Plus
contents: Huawei’s online-centric sub-brand  Honor  is turning one very soon and they are kicking off a celebration event at KLCC on 28th April 2015. This marks exactly a year since its cheap and cheerful  Honor 3C  had  made its debut  in Malaysia for RM499. Apart from the celebrations, Huawei is dropping more hints that the  Honor 6 Plus  is coming to Malaysia soon. The event invite image shown above shows an Honor 6 Plus outline with a double camera lens at the back.  In addition, its likely  Honor 6 Plus product page  was spotted on Vmall.my but it is currently masked under the name “HonorBokeh”, which is referring to its symmetrical dual-camera technology. Coincidentally, Honor Malaysia’s FB page has been using the  #HonorBokeh  hashtag in their teasers. To refresh your memory, the  Honor 6 Plus  is the phablet brother of their current Honor 6. It has a larger 5.5″ Full HD display and it runs on an upgraded Kirin 925 1.8GHz Octa-Core processor with 3GB of RAM. There’s also a microSD slot which doubles up as a 2nd SIM slot.  The main highlight of course is the rear camera where it gets a dual-8MP set up that’s capable of capturing 13MP photos. Huawei calls it a symmetrial dual camera tech which claims to provide faster focus of 0.1 seconds. Similar to HTC One’s Duo-Camera feature, the Honor 6 Plus is able to take depth of field effects after your picture is taken. For selfies, the front gets a 8MP Sony BSI camera.  With a bigger device, the Honor 6 Plus gets a huge 3,600mAh capacity battery which could provide more than a day’s worth of usage. While the Honor 6 uses plastic flap covers for its ports, the Honor 6 Plus feels more upmarket with flush trays that requires a pin to eject.  In China, the Honor 6 Plus is  priced  at 2,499 CNY for the Dual-SIM 4G version, which is about RM1,465 when converted directly. At the moment, the 5″ Honor 6 is now priced at RM1,059 inclusive of 6% GST.  All is likely to be revealed at Honor Malaysia’s first anniversary bash on 28th April. To participate, you can sign up for an invite over at  VMall.my . Only 30 lucky participants will be invited to the event with RM200 worth of door gifts to be given away.   [  SOURCE ,  VIA (Lee Cheah Eu) Closed Group  ]

author: soyacincau
title: Samsung Galaxy S6 edge in Gold reported to be a hot seller in Malaysia
tags: Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge colours,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Gold,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Gold Platinum,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Malaysia,Samsung Galaxy S6 Malaysia
contents: As the  Galaxy S6  and  Galaxy S6 edge  went officially on sale today, Samsung Malaysia has shared that the Galaxy S6 edge in gold is proven to be a popular choice among Malaysians. According to its VP for Mobile & IT, Mr. Lee Jui Siang, the Gold Platinum Galaxy S6 edge has sold out and they are restocking them as soon as possible to keep up with demand. Without giving local numbers, Samsung claims to have received about 20 million pre-orders globally since its international launch at MWC 2015. In terms of colour options, the Galaxy S6 edge is available in White Pearl, Black Sapphire, Gold Platinum, and a unique Green Emerald which is  currently exclusive  to Maxis. Meanwhile its standard Galaxy S6 is also available in White Pearl, Black Sapphire, Gold Platinum, and  exclusive to Celcom  is the striking Blue Topaz colour option. The Galaxy S6 and Galaxy S6 edge are priced at RM2,599 and RM3,099 respectively inclusive of 6% GST. Check out some photos from the Galaxy S6 consumer launch at The Gardens Midvalley after the break. For all you need to know about the latest Samsung flagship, check out our recap over  here .

author: soyacincau
title: Xiaomi continues to tease its new i Global Smart Phone. You can catch the launch live
tags: Global Mi Phone Premiere,I is coming,live stream,mi 4i,Xiaomi,Xiaomi 2015015,Xiaomi Global Phone Launch,Xiaomi i is coming,XIaomi International Xiaomi Launch,Xiaomi Mi 4 International,Xiaomi Mi 4i,Xiaomi Mi 4i Certification,Xiaomi Mi 4i Launch,Xiaomi New Phone Launch
contents: Xiaomi will be announcing its  new Global smart phone  with a strong emphasis on “i” all over. This is their first major event that’s held outside of China, marking its significant commitment for international markets.  As we draw closer to its announcement even on 23rd April, Xiaomi has dropped a couple of vague clues of its upcoming smart phone. Without giving specifics, the new model could feature a bigger battery while maining a compact design. Design wise, it also implies a different craftsmanship and appearance despite looking the same.  From what we  gathered , the new device could be a  Mi 4i  which is an international variant of its current Mi 4 compact flagship. In terms of specs, the Mi 4i is spotted with a mid-range Octa-Core Snapdragon 615 processor with 2GB RAM and 16GB of storage. Display is likely to be a slightly smaller 4.9″ with Full HD resolution. Overall, this looks like a step back from its  Mi 4 , but if it gets a wider range of 4G LTE bands and a lower price tag, this could be a compelling mid-ranger that’s priced under RM1,000. This is good news for us Malaysians as the Mi 4  lacked 2600MHz LTE support  which is widely use here. To catch the  announcement  as it happens, the event will be streamed live this Thursday on  Mi’s website  and it the feed will start at 2PM (India Time), which is 4:30PM in Malaysia. We will be covering the announcement live, so follow us on  Twitter  &  Facebook  for the latest updates. [  SOURCE  ]

author: soyacincau
title: HTC Malaysia teases 28 April event. Is HTC One M9+ coming?
tags: Android,HTC,HTC Malaysia,HTC One M9,HTC One M9 Malaysia,HTC One M9 Plus,HTCOneLife,More Than One,smart phone
contents: The  HTC One M9  which was announced at  MWC 2015  could be near. HTC Malaysia has just tweeted a teaser image along with 28th April 2015 suggesting that a One M9 launch is in the works but from the information posted on HTC Malaysia’s Ow.ly account, it looks like that Malaysia could be getting “ More Than One ” device from HTC. The  One M9+  was  announced  recently in Beijing at an event that carried the headline “More Than One”. The One M9+ is a bigger device with a 5.2″ display that pushes a Quad HD resolution. Instead of a Snapdragon 810 processor features in the One M9, the One M9+ runs a MediaTek MT6795 processor and 3GB RAM. Together with the One M9+, HTC also announced the One  One E9+  which gets a larger 5.5″ Quad HD display but has only 2GB of RAM and 16GB of on-board storage. You can read up more on the two devices  here . Will HTC be launching more than one device in Malaysia? We’ll find out in two weeks but more importantly, will you be  interested ? Let us know in the comments section.  [  SOURCE  ]

author: soyacincau
title: Is Huawei Malaysia teasing its upcoming P8 flagship?
tags: Android,huawei,Huawei Malaysia,Huawei P8,Huawei P8 Malaysia,Huawei P8 Max,smart phone
contents: UPDATE : The teaser is merely for a  GroufieWithHuawei contest .  Huawei Malaysia has started a series of teasers in the past few days, rallying its fans to gather more people for a groufie. Without giving much details, Huawei Malaysia claims to be revealing something amazing today and we have a hunch that this is a new device. Fresh from last week’s  Huawei P8 announcement , this could be a hint of its Malaysian launch considering we are among the first wave of 30 countries to have it. From the 2 teasers, despite showing its current Ascend P7, there are some elements of the P8 including the light painted infinity sign and that  mystery hooded guy  from their official teaser. However its activity of getting people to take a group/wide selfie could be a contest to win special invites to a launch, which seems to be a thing these days for Chinese/Taiwanese brands. The P8 is the successor of the current Ascend P7 and it gets a more upmarket unibody metal design. The front gets a 5.2″ Full HD display and powering it is their in-house Kirin 930/935 Octa-Core processor with 3GB of RAM. For storage, it gets 16GB for its standard version and a much generous 64GB option for its Premium model. For taking pictures, it gets a 13MP camera which shoots in 4 colours (RGBW) instead of a conventional RGB set up. For the front, it gets an 8MP selfie shooter. Keeping the lights on is a 2,600mAh capacity battery and it maintains an impressive thickness of 6.4mm. Other than the P8, there’s a larger P8 Max phablet with a huge 6.8″ Full HD display. It has similar specs as the standard P8 but it gets a smaller 5MP front camera but a larger 4,360mAh capacity battery. Despite its larger dimensions, it still manages to be thinner than the iPhone 6 Plus at only 6.8mm. You can read more about both devices in our  P8 announcement post . [  SOURCE ,  2 ,  3  ]

author: soyacincau
title: Sony Xperia Z4 now official. Incremental flagship update with an Octa-Core Processor
tags: Android,smart phone,Sony,Sony Xperia Z4,Sony Xperia Z4 launch,Sony Xperia Z4 Official,Sony Xperia Z4 Photos,Xperia Z4
contents: Out of the blue without much fanfare, Sony Mobile has officially announced its new  Xperia Z4  flagship smart phone. Like the recently announced  HTC One M9 , the Xperia Z4 looks similar to its predecessor model,  Xperia Z3  but it gets some incremental updates under the hood. The front retains the same 5.2″ display that does a full HD resolution of 1920×1080. Powering the device is Qualcomm’s top end 2.0GHz Snapdragon 810 Octa-Core processor that’s mated with 3GB of RAM. The on-board storage however gets an increase to 32GB and it has an expandable microSD slot that supports 128GB extra. As you would expect from a flagship Sony Xperia, it also gets water and dust resistance at IPX5/8, IP6X. For imaging, it retains the same 20.7MP BSI main camera with 25mm wide angle lens that supports 4K video recording but the front is now upgraded to a higher resolution 5MP camera. For its battery, it gets a smaller 2,950mAh non-removable unit (Z3: 3,200mAh) and as a result, it is much thinner at 6.9mm (Xperia Z3: 7.3mm) and weighs just 144 grams (Xperia Z3: 152g). Since the Xperia Z4 sticks to a standard Full HD resolution, it may still be able retain its famed “up to 2 days” of battery life.  For better group selfies, the front 5MP shooter also gets a 25mm wide angle lens and there’s even a digital image stabilisation for a more steadier shot. For those who love taking food pics, there’s a cooking mode to make your #foodporn pics more vibrant.  The build quality should be similar with its current Xperia Z3 with the use of rounded metal frames on each end. In terms of colours, it is available in White, Black, Copper and Aqua Green. Another welcome change is having an exposed microUSB port as what we’ve seen in the  earlier leaks . This makes charging easier without the hassle of a waterproof flap cover. So far, the Xperia Z4 is only listed on Sony Mobile’s Japan site and there’s no word of it being released overseas. What do you think of the Xperia Z4? Leave your thoughts in the comments below. [  SOURCE ,  VIA ,  2  ]

author: soyacincau
title: Latest WhatsApp with Google Drive Backup is now available for Android
tags: Backup,Google Drive,Instant Messaging,Whatsapp,WhatsApp Backup,WhatsApp Cloud Storage,WhatsApp for Android,WhatsApp Google Drive Backup
contents: After introducing  WhatsApp for Web  and  WhatsApp Voice , their upcoming feature would be good news for those that switch phones often. If you’re tired of manually copying WhatsApp database files, their new version now supports direct  cloud backup  with Google Drive integration.  At time of writing, it isn’t available officially on our  Google Play Store  but you may download the latest WhatsApp version 2.12.45 as  an APK download . After installing the latest version, you’ll notice a new Material Design UI and you can find the cloud storage backup feature under Settings > Chat Settings > Chat Backup. From here, you’ll need to associate a Google Drive account to WhatsApp. If you’re afraid of consuming your precious mobile data, you’re also able to set to backup over WiFi only. In terms of backup, WhatsApp would upload incremental updates after its initial upload. This means it will only backup subsequent bite size changes instead of the entire backup file periodically. You are able to set the frequency of the backup from daily, weekly or monthly. Only chat conversations and photos are saved, so you’ll still need to backup videos the old fashion way. The next time you install WhatsApp on a fresh smart phone, you’ll be asked if you have a Google Drive account to restore.  If you want to try it out now, you can download the latest APK file  here . [  SOURCE ,  VIA  ]

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Google releases new Handwriting Input, will make sense of your scribbles in 82 languages
tags: Free,google,google handwriting input,Google Play Store,handwriting app,mobile apps
contents: Google has released a new handwriting keyboard for Android, aptly named Google Handwriting Input. The app will run on any device sporting Ice Cream Sandwich and up, with support for both cursive and print writing. Once downloaded you can switch it out with your regular keyboard and it sports the same styling as the Google Keyboard so you’ll feel right at home. You even have the option to swap back and forth from your regular keyboard on the fly. In a nutshell, the app will allow you to enter emojis by drawing and it’s apparently great for languages that are difficult to type on with a standard keyboard. It’s also a neat alternative to touchscreen typing or voice input plus Google claims it’s capable of handling even the ugliest of handwriting. If you want to check it out for yourself, you can download it  free at the Google Play store , though it seems to not be available for Malaysian users yet but you can still get it via an  APK downloader . [ SOURCE ]

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Oppo R7 images and video show off an edge to edge screen
contents: Seems like the Chinese manufacturers are really pulling out all the stops, as these leaked images of the supposed 5.5-inch Oppo R7 showcases a practically edge to edge screen. Check out the video below to see the screen in action.

author: soyacincau
title: Xiaomi Redmi 2 offered for free on Digi SmartPlan
tags: DiGi,Digi redmi 2,digi xiaomi redmi 2,Dual Sim,Redmi 2,Redmi 2 Malaysia,Xiaomi,Xiaomi Redmi 2,Xiaomi Redmi 2 Malaysia
categories: Android,DiGi,Mobile Devices,Mobile OS,Players on the Field,Xiaomi
contents: Xiaomi’s entry-level  Redmi 2  is now available on contract with Digi’s  new Smart Plans  that offers either more voice or more data. To recap on the Redmi 2, this RM449 entry level smart phone offers a 4.7″ HD 720p screen, Quad-Core Snapdragon 410 processor, 1GB of RAM and 8GB storage that’s expandable with microSD. It also gets a 8MP main + 2MP front camera, along with a 2,200mAh capacity battery. The free Redmi 2 bundling is applicable for SmartPlan 108 and 148. Below is the full pricing with 24 months contract: As usual, you would need to fork out an advance payment along with a month subscription during sign up. This amounts from RM180 to its full retail price of RM449 during sign up. For EPP, the bundling price is cheaper since you are charged the full 24 month subscription onto your credit card. For more info, head over to Digi’s  Redmi 2  page.

author: soyacincau
title: Yes offers Samsung Galaxy S6 with Huddle XS MiFi bundling
tags: Android,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 Malaysia,smart phone,Yes,yes 4g,Yes 4G Galaxy S6,Yes Huddle XS
categories: Android,Mobile Devices,Mobile OS,Players on the Field,Samsung,Yes
contents: If you’re looking to buy a  Galaxy S6  on contract but not from  Celcom, Digi or Maxis , you can probably consider this option from 4G WiMAX operator Yes. Instead of a usual smart phone mobile plan, Yes is bundling it together with its Super Postpaid Broadband package that comes with a Huddle XS MiFi hotspot. The Galaxy S6 which retails at RM2,599 (with GST) can be yours at RM846.94 (inclusive of 6% GST) with 24 months contract of Yes Super 158 plan (10GB). If that’s too high a commitment, it is bundled on Super 128 postpaid plan at RM1,376.94 (with GST) and that gives you 8GB of data for RM128/month. Both plans come with 2,000 minutes of voice calls and 2,000 SMS which is to be utilised though its Yes Life app. In terms of colours, Yes is only offering the Galaxy S6 in Gold and White. During sign up, you’ll need to pay an upfront fee of RM800 for Super 128 and RM1,240 for Super 158. For more information, visit Yes’s  Galaxy S6  promo page.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Huawei P8 Lite: The mid-range model that’s yet to be announced
tags: Android,emotion UI,huawei,Huawei P8,huawei p8 lite,mobile phone,rumour mill
contents: Having been  leaked  prior to  last night’s event  but was myseriously not announced, the Huawei P8 Lite continues to stay under wraps despite having a product page at the ready. Some official images of the P8 Lite have already hit the internet, which is likely what we will be getting once it actually comes out.  The mid-ranger is rumoured to be retailing for approximately €270 (about RM 1054) and the phone will be about 7.7mm thick and won’t have a solid metal body. The P8 Lite should run on Emotion UI 3.1 on top of Android 5.0 at launch and is likely to have 4GLTE and dual SIM capabilities like it’s siblings. Under the hood you will have a 1.2GHz octa-core Kirin 620 chip like the Huawei Honor 4X, and it will run on 2GB RAM plus 16GB expandable storage via microSD slot. The phone will also be sporting a 720p screen, which is odd considering it should at the very least be 1080p given the screen size. As for the camera you will have a 13MP rear camera alongside a 5MP front snapper though there hasn’t been any mention of image stabilization or the sensor. In terms of battery life the phone will have a 2,200mAh battery powering the lot, though it doesn’t look like it will be removable. [ VIA ][ SOURCE ]

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Samsung Galaxy S6 beats the rest in new durability video
tags: apple,Bend Test,Bendgate,galaxy S6 edge,iPhone 6,iPhone 6 Plus,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6,smartphone,Video
contents: From the very same guys who brought you the  Samsung Galaxy S6 edge bend test , SquareTrade decided to seriously up the ante by bringing in five phones to be be dropped, bent and dunked to see who comes out on top. For this test, the phones in question are the Samsung Galaxy S5,  Samsung Galaxy S6 ,  Galaxy S6 edge  as well as the  Apple iPhone 6  and  iPhone 6 Plus  to see who can survive best. Of the four, the Samsung Galaxy S6 turned out to be the least bendy of the four, surviving 110 pounds of pressure while the S6 edge cracked and the two iPhones totally bent. The Galaxy S6 and edge slid further than the rest in the slide test but they survived six drops from six feet high without breaking while the iPhone 6 Plus fell apart completely and stopped working after the test. This chart lists down the final scores of each phone in detail based on their tests. They don’t fully represent real world results however they should give you a rough idea on what to expect. Check out the video below for more. [ SOURCE ]

author: Sirap Bandung
title: OnePlus to introduce 2 new phones, target 5 million units for 2015
tags: Cyanogen,mobile device,OnePlus,OnePlus One,oneplus two,oxygen,rumour mill,smartphone
contents: After finally rolling out  Cyanogen OS 12  and  Oxygen  for the OnePlus One, the Chinese brand is looking to expand their company even further as it plans to boosts output. They have plans to increase their staff to 1,500 employees this year and the successor to the  OnePlus One , which is likely to be called the OnePlus Two, is estimated to be available by the third quarter of this year with better hardware than it’s predecessor. OnePlus sold over a million smartphones last year and they’re ambitiously planning to ship out between three to five million units this year, especially with the new model on the way. No details yet on the new phone but we expect they will become available as we approach Q3. In the mean time, if you want to snag the OnePlus One locally,  you can pick one up from Maxis . [ VIA ][ SOURCE ]

author: soyacincau
title: OnePlus Malaysian Fan Gathering is happening on 24 April
tags: Android,Maxis,Maxis OnePlus Fan Gathering,OnePlus,OnePlus Malaysia,OnePlus Malaysia Launch,OnePlus One,OnePlus One Malaysia,OnePlus One Malaysia Fan Gathering,OnePlus One Malaysia Launch,OnePlus One Maxis,OnePlus One Pre-order,OnePlus smartphone,smart phone,smartphone
contents: The  OnePlus One  will be officially  available in Malaysia  next week on Wednesday, 22nd April. To celebrate its Malaysian debut, OnePlus is kicking off another Fan Gathering at the roof top of Maxis Tower in KLCC. The event is happening next Friday, 24th April from 3:00PM to 5:30PM. To join in, you’ll need to  register yourself  and share this  facebook post  to win yourself an invite to the exclusive roof top event. There are only 80 seats available and 10 lucky participants will get to win freebies of either a OnePlus Power Bank or a Bamboo StyleSwap Cover for you One.  The OnePlus One will be offered  exclusively on Maxis  with their MaxisOne Plan. Just want to buy the One without a plan? OnePlus Malaysia  assures  that it will be available without contract at retail outlets.  [  SOURCE  ]

author: soyacincau
title: Purported Honor 7 leaked with fingerprint scanner
tags: Android,Honor,Honor 7,Honor 7 Leaks,huawei,Huawei Honor,Huawei Honor 7,Huawei Honor 7 Plus
contents: Right after unveiling its new  P8 flagship , word has it that Huawei is working on a new successor for its Honor line up. The current  Honor 6  is one of our favourite smart phones priced below RM1,000. Now it appears that its new Honor 7 sequel could be announced very soon.  From a couple of purported leaked shots, the new Honor flagships appears to have gone upmarket with a full unibody metal design. Also seen from the picture above is a fingerprint scanner mounted at the back. This looks quite similar with its current  Ascend Mate 7  phablet that features a one touch fingerprint scanner. Also visible is a dual-tone LED flash, which should provide more natural looking photos when flash is used.  In terms of specs, the Honor 7 is said to be having a 5.5″ Full HD display and powering the device is their latest Kirin 930/935 processor with 3GB of RAM. On-board storage is mentioned to be 16GB and it should run on the latest Android 5.0 Lollipop with Emotion UI 3.1.  For a 5.5 incher, we reckon this could be a Honor 7 Plus, like its current 5.5″ Honor 6 Plus phablet, while the actual Honor 7 would likely to maintain a more compact 5″ size. In another separate set of images, there’s also another device that carries a duo-camera set up at the rear. This could be a different model or yet another prototype of the new Honor flagship. With the usage of more market materials, the next Honor might probably be more expensive just like their latest P8. The Huawei P8 would  cost close to RM2,000  for its low spec model. This is quite a jump from the  Ascend P7  that was priced at RM1,499. Like any leaks, we recommend taking this with a pinch of salt.  [  SOURCE ,  VIA  ]

author: soyacincau
title: Samsung Galaxy S6 and S6 edge goes on sale in Malaysia. All you need to know here.
tags: Android,Galaxy S6 Malaysia,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Malaysia,Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge Malaysia Launch,Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Malaysia Promo,Samsung Galaxy S6 Malaysia,Samsung Galaxy S6 Malaysia Launch,Samsung Galaxy S6 Malaysia Promo,samsung malaysia,smart phone
contents:
The  Samsung Galaxy S6  and  S6 edge  were  launched in Malaysia  earlier this month and they are now officially available starting today 17th April 2015. To recap on the price, both flagships are going for RM2,599 for the standard S6 while the double curved display Galaxy S6 edge is priced at RM3,099. In Malaysia, both Galaxy S6 and S6 edge comes with 32GB of on-board storage, which isn’t expandable. Probably for the first time for a Samsung flagship smart phone in Malaysia, they are also offering a  personalised pick up service  with a 24 hours dedicated toll free number. So if you have any problems with your device, they can come to your home or office to collect your device as an added convenience.  In terms of availability, the big 3 telcos, Celcom, Digi and Maxis have ran pre-orders and most recently Yes, the 4G WiMAX operator is  offering  the Galaxy S6 as well. You can also get it from authorised Samsung retail outlets including SenHeng. For today’s official availability day, Samsung Malaysia is having a  consumer launch event  at their outlet in The Gardens Mall at MidValley. The first 30 in line will get an exclusive autographed badminton racquet by Dato Lee Chong Wei. Samsung Malaysia is also  offering  the  Wireless Charger  for RM49.90 at selected outlets while stocks last.  Head after the break for all you need to know about the Galaxy S6 and Galaxy S6 edge in Malaysia. Samsung Galaxy S6 edge Review

author: soyacincau
title: Duracell creates a wireless charging solution that’s more complicated than wired chargers
tags: Duracell,Duracell Powermat,Duracell Wireless Charger,Wireless Charger,Wireless Charging
contents: Wireless charging is supposed to make life easier. Whenever your device needs to juice up, you can just leave it on a wireless charger without worrying about cables. For devices that doesn’t come with wireless charging built-in, the usual solution is to buy a wireless charging case or a cover with a charging coil built-in. Somehow the guys at Duracell think that’s too complicated so they have introduced something else instead.  What you’re seeing above is the Duracell micro USB Ring which houses the induction charger coil that can be plugged onto any device like a USB OTG thumb drive. While this sounds good for compatibility, the execution of it is rather flawed. To charge on the charging mat, you can probably imagine how impractical it is to position the ring on the wireless charger. Guess what, they actually thought of it and also included in this US$54 (about RM200) solution is a dummy stand so that it can support your device. In terms of support, it only supports PMA wireless charging which is different from the more popular Qi chargers that adopt WPC standards. Apparently its main company, P&G is a member of the Power Matters Alliance (PMA). A wireless charger that requires 3 separate components? We would rather stick to fast wired chargers any day.  [  SOURCE ,  VIA  ]

author: soyacincau
title: LG G4 highlights its improved Quad HD display in latest teaser
tags: IPS Quantum Display,LG G4,LG G4 Camera,LG G4 display,LG G4 launch,LG G4 Specs,LG G4 Teaser,smart phone
contents: The next flagship to be revealed is the  LG G4  on the 28th of April. In its second teaser, LG focuses on its new IPS Quantum display which pushes a similar Quad HD resolution of 2560×1440 as the previous LG G3. While the resolution and 5.5″ screen size provides the same 538ppi pixel density, the new Quantum display promises 25% brighter and 20% wider colour range than its previous model. The LG G4 isn’t much of a surprise anymore as it was  leaked quite extensively  over the weekend. The back of the device comes with a full leather back option with stitching details, along with its signature rear mounted volume rocker and power button. The camera has been  confirmed  to be a f/1.8 16MP unit while the front gets a larger 8MP shooter. Check out the LG G4 teaser video after the break.

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Ninebot absorbs Segway, gets funding from Xiaomi
tags: merger,Ninebot,personal mobility device,segway,Xiaomi
contents: Remember that mystery personal mobility device  Xiaomi was talking about ? turns out that Xiaomi has become one of the investors to Ninebot Inc, who also just announced a strategic alliance with Segway; with the two companies to produce more innovations in the short-distance transportation industry. In the press conference held in Beijing at the JW Marriott Hotel, Ninebot revealed that they had raised $80 million in Series A funding from Xiaomi Technology, Sequoia Capitial and Shunwei Foundation among others, and funding is to go into development of products including electric driving, mobile internet and man-machine interaction on top of well, making more Segway type products. Segway President Rod Keller has high hopes for the merger and is quite confident over the future of the company. Xiaomi is already known to handle everything from air purifiers to CCTVs, so adding a personal mobility device to it’s repertoire of products doesn’t seem too far fetched. But the question is, would be it as ‘cheap’ as they are known to be?

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Samsung Galaxy S6 gets a teardown, is slightly easier to repair than the S6 edge
tags: galaxy S6,ifixit,Samsung,Samsung Galaxy S6,samsung galaxy s6 teardown,teardown
contents:
Not too long ago the Samsung Galaxy S6 edge got a teardown and scored pretty badly in terms of repairability. Now it’s sibling the Galaxy S6 get’s picked apart by iFixit and as it turns out, it’s just slightly easier to fix than the S6 edge. As it turns out, the insides of both phones share a lot in common, from the nasty amounts of internal adhesives to internals that are pretty much arranged almost 90% the same, meaning screen aside taking both apart would be similarly difficult, though removing the battery for the S6 was a lot easier. Unfortunately, like it’s sibling it would be very hard to replace both glass surfaces without destroying them in the process, and general efforts to get it open were still quite difficult. You can check out the full teardown below. //

// ]]> Samsung Galaxy S6 Teardown

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Sony Xperia Z4 or Z3 Neo could be unveiled 20th April
tags: rumour mill,Sony,sony xperia,sony xperia Z3 neo,Sony Xperia Z4,Sony Xperia Z4 launch,Xperia
contents: Sony still hasn’t launched any flagship smartphones this year and we are now in the second quarter of 2015. But according to a report from Japan, Sony may be announcing a new phone on the coming 20th April which is essentially next week. The new flagship is predicted to be the long awaited  Sony Xperia Z4  but there’s also a chance that it might be the Sony Xperia Z3 Neo instead, which has also  been leaked  very recently. It’s still up in the air because not all the rumours and leaks add up but Sony has been rumoured to no longer be launching more than one flagship at a time so which phone exactly will be getting the announcement next week is up to debate, if the phone is even the Z4 or the Z3 Neo at all. [ VIA ] [ SOURCE ]

author: Sirap Bandung
title: Gamers can now top up their favourite online games with Hotlink Game Credits
tags: asiasoft,CIB,CIB games,cubinet,esports,Game top up,garena,Hotlink,hotlink games,IAHGames
contents: Hotlink has just partnered up with some of the nations’ more popular online game publishers to launch the Game Credits Top Up facility which allows gamers to top up their games using Hotlink Top Up Tickets. Partnering up with publishers Asiasoft, CIB, Garena, Cubinet and IAHGames, users who are already Hotlink customers will get additional benefits like in-game items for League of Legends, EA FIFA ONLINE 3, Blackshot and extra in-game cash for IAH Games titles like Granado Espada and CounterStrike. During the launch period, Hotlink customers who top up via Hotlink top up tickets will get the following benefits: If you want to get in on the action, it’s pretty easy to use the Game Credits. Simply sign-in to your games account at the publisher’s website and select payment or top-up. From there select Hotlink Top-up Ticket as a payment option and either log in or perform a one time registration and key in the 16-digit key on your top up and you’re done. For more info on the games and promotion, check out  www.hotlink.com.my/games .

author: soyacincau
title: OnePlus One will be offered exclusively on Maxis
tags: Android,Android 5.0,Brighstar,Maxis,Maxis OnePlus One,MaxisONE Plan,OnePlus,OnePlus Malaysia,OnePlus Malaysia Launch,OnePlus Maxis,OnePlus One,OnePlus One Malaysia,OnePlus One Malaysia Fan Gathering,OnePlus One Malaysia Launch,OnePlus One Maxis,OnePlus One Pre-order,OnePlus smartphone,smart phone,smartphone
categories: Android,Maxis,Mobile Devices,Mobile OS,OnePlus,Players on the Field
contents: It is better late than never and OnePlus One is finally  making its way officially  into Malaysia. As the  OnePlus Malaysian site  went live, its pre-order page is linked to Maxis  OnePlus page  which is shown to be coming soon. From the looks of it, Maxis is the exclusive telco for the One  but it isn’t clear if there are other channels where you can purchase it without contract . UPDATE : According to OnePlus,  you can buy  the OnePlus One outright without contract at Maxis Stores. According to a  source  that tipped  Amanz , the OnePlus One would be offered on MaxisOne Plan + 1GB at RM959. In addition, they are said to be giving extra monthly rebates of RM30 for 12 months. Outright, the One is listed at RM1,299 inclusive of GST and this is likely to be the 16GB model. With a mere RM340 subsidy, it is likely to be bundled with a shorter 12 month contract.  However a quick check on Maxis’s  Device page  has listed the OnePlus One being offered for free. However this could be just a temporary placeholder as a Sony Xperia device is being shown by mistake. We’ll find out for sure on its final offering when we get closer to its  22nd April launch .   [  SOURCE ,  2  ]

author: soyacincau
title: Huawei announces its new flagship duo – the P8 and P8 Max
tags: Android,Dual Sim,huawei,Huawei Ascend P8,Huawei P8,Huawei P8 Launch,Huawei P8 Malaysia,Huawei P8 Max,Huawei P8 Max Launch,Huawei P8 Max Malaysia,Huawei P8max,smart phone
contents: Huawei today has announced its new flagship smart phone line up with their new P8. Dropping its Ascend naming, the latest flagships now come in two sizes, the 5.2″ P8 and a larger 6.8″ P8 Max phablet. Both screens are still pushing Full HD 1080p resolution and powering the device is their in-house developed 64-bit Kirin 930/935 Octa-Core processor that boasts 2X the performance of its former Ascend P7.  With most brands focusing on premium design, Huawei has stepped up with a better crafted unibody metal design with a larger screen to body aspect ratio. Although the 5.2″ is big in size, it is roughly the same size as the 4.7″ iPhone 6. The P8 is still incredibly slim at 6.4mm while its larger P8 Max phablet has a respectably thin side profile at 6.8mm.  Its imaging capabilities take centre stage with what they claimed to be the world’s first 4-colour 13MP camera in RGBW format. For stable shots, it is also assisted by Optical Image Stabilisation that claims to tolerate shakes better at 1.2 degrees, which is double of the iPhone 6 Plus. There are a couple of camera tricks included which makes light painting a breeze with real time preview. For the front, it gets a 8MP selfie camera for the P8 and a 5MP shooter on the P8 Max. As usual, it also comes equipped with group selfie and beautification features.  There are a couple of new additions with the P8 including a new Knuckle Technology. This is basically a new gesture feature that lets you use your hand knuckles to draw or to crop images on the device. In terms of accessories, what we found interesting is an add-on 4.3″ E-ink display which is attached to the back of the device. This looks like an interesting alternative to the dual-screen YotaPhone.  Both P8 and P8 Max claims to provide more than a day’s worth of use on a single charge. The compact P8’s 2,600mAh capacity battery is rated to last 1.5 days on average or 1 day of heavy usage. Meanwhile the mammoth P8 Max with a huge 4,360mAh battery claims to push more than 2 days of use or 1.4 days for heavy duty users. To prolong its battery life, there are some software features like an App Firewall which blocks power hungry apps from running in the background. Out of the box, it runs on Android 5.0 with its custom Emotion UI 3.1. For each model, it comes with either standard or high-spec version  and fortunately Huawei is packing 3GB of RAM across the range. The only difference is storage where the P8 gets 16GB for standard and 64GB for the premium model. For the P8 Max, it starts with a minimum of 32GB storage for the standard and it doubles up to 64GB for the premium version. To distinguise the versions, the standard version comes in Titanium Grey and Mystic Champagne, while the Premium version gets Carbon Black and Prestige Gold colour options. The Huawei P8 is a dual-SIM 4G LTE device which comes with 2 nano-SIM slots. If you need more storage, the 2nd SIM slot can be used for microSD expansion. Connectivity shouldn’t be an issue as it supports a wide array of 4G LTE bands in FDD and TDD standards, while reception has been improved with a dual antenna design. For those who roam a lot, the device has a Roaming+ feature that allows it to connect to your roaming partner telco 3X quicker than other devices. In terms of price, the P8 standard version goes for 499 Euros (RM1958) and 599 Euros (RM2352) for the premium model. The larger 6.8″ Huawei P8 max is priced at 549 Euros (RM2155) for standard and 649 Euros (RM2548) for Premium.  Overall the P8 is quite a huge step up from its previous P7 flagship and this is quite obvious with its higher price tag. On the Ascend P7, the performance was quite disappointing from its Kirin 910T processor which pales in comparison to its affordable Honor 6 with Kirin 920. With its price tag touching the RM2,000 mark, Huawei believes they are now on par with the establishments in terms of build quality and performance. During the event, Huawei has mentioned that the new devices will be available first in 30 countries and good news for us, Malaysia is part of the list.

author: soyacincau
title: OnePlus One finally comes to Malaysia on 22 April
tags: Android,Android 5.0,Brighstar,OnePlus,OnePlus Malaysia,OnePlus Malaysia Launch,OnePlus One,OnePlus One Malaysia,OnePlus One Malaysia Fan Gathering,OnePlus One Malaysia Launch,OnePlus One Pre-order,OnePlus smartphone,smart phone,smartphone
contents: UPDATE : OnePlus One will be  available  on Maxis contract.  After what seems to be a  long wait , OnePlus is officially making its way into Malaysia, for real. In a forum post, the they have announced 22nd April as their official Malaysian launch date and you can buy the global  OnePlus One  units at their official  Malaysian site  (to be made live very soon). For loyal OnePlus forum members, they will be giving a special forum-only password where you can redeem an extra token of appreciation when you place your orders. After the launch, they will be organising another fan gathering on 24th of April. More details of the event will be shared within the next few days.  To recap on the specs, the One features a 5.5″ Full HD 1080p display and it runs on a 2.5GHz Quad-Core Snapdragon 801 processor with 3GB of RAM. The back gets a 13MP Sony IMX214 camera with 6 element f/2.0 lens while selfie shots are handled by its 5MP front camera. While the specs are similar with the OPPO Find 7 (sans Quad HD display), the battery isn’t replaceable but it gets a slightly larger 3,100mAh capacity battery. Overall it is 8.9mm thick and weighs 162 grams. Pricing wise, the 16GB version in Silk White is priced internationally at US$299 while the 64GB in Sandstone Black is priced at US$349. This roughly converts to RM1,100 and RM1,290 respectively before GST.  They didn’t mention how is the sale is going to be done and whether there’s an invite required before hand. Just last month, the OnePlus One had reappeared on SIRIM and was  certified  under Brightstar. For more info, it is probably best to check on their official  Facebook page .  Are you still waiting for the 2014 flagship killer? Mark your calendars for next Wednesday, 22nd April.  [  SOURCE  ]

author: soyacincau
title: Microsoft Surface 3 pre order is now open. Stocks available in Malaysia on 5th May
tags: microsoft,Microsoft Malaysia,Microsoft Surface 3,Microsoft Surface 3 Hands-on,Microsoft Surface 3 Malaysia,Microsoft Surface 3 Malaysia Pre-order,Microsoft Surface 3 Pre-order,Senheng,Surface 3,Surface 3 Malaysia,Surface 3 Malaysia price
contents:
The  Microsoft Surface 3  is the affordable answer to its  Surface Pro 3 . It gets the same design and form factor as its bigger brother but comes in a smaller and lighter package. At the front, it gets a 10.8″ ClearType Full HD Plus display and it runs on Intel’s 1.6GHz Quad-Core Atom x7-Z8700 processor, which Microsoft claims to deliver 80% performance of an Intel Core i3 processor.  There are 2 models available with the base version having 2GB of RAM and 64GB storage priced at RM1,989 including of GST. If you need more, the higher spec 4GB RAM and 128GB storage version is going for RM2,389. For now it is a WiFi only device supporting 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac and Bluetooth 4.0. A 4G LTE version is said to be in the pipeline but Microsoft has yet to provide specific timelines for the Malaysian market. It also gets a front facing 3.5MP camera and a rear 8MP unit which both are capable of shooting Full HD 1080p resolution. In terms of options, the Surface 3 Type keyboard is sold separately at RM479 and it comes in choice of Black, Bright Blue and Red colours. If you plan to scribble, the Surface Pen which is also available in the same array of colours would cost you an extra RM189. There’s also a docking station for a full desktop experience with display, LAN and extra USB ports but it sets you back at RM769.  When compared to its larger Surface Pro 3, the Surface 3 is much lighter and thinner at 622 grams with a thickness of 8.7mm. The on-board battery is said to last 10 hours of video playback and for charging, it uses a more universal micro-USB port. So if you’re out of juice, you can easily charge using a power bank. Another key difference with the Surface Pro 3 is the kickstand, where it offers a fixed 3 step position. This according to Microsoft is done in order to reduce its thickness.  For the starting price of RM1,989, it does sound steep for a tablet. However with a full Windows 8.1 experience and the option to upgrade to Windows 10 when it is available, it is a step up for those who want a productivity tool in a compact tablet form factor. The price isn’t too bad considering the popular iPad Air 2 WiFi version is now  much more expensive  at RM2,045 for 64GB and RM2,384 for the 128GB version.  In our brief preview, it feels just as competent as a laptop and it should be good enough to handle all your web browsing, media viewing and office productivity needs. If you need more power for video editing, then you probably might want to consider its higher end Surface Pro 3 that comes with Core i3, i5 and i7 processor options.  If you’re interested, the Microsoft Surface 3 can be pre-ordered at the following links and stocks will be available for the general public on 5th May 2015. Aone Plus Supplies and Services

Hello Station (Nokia Outlet)
